name: Cloister Inn Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: During our trip to Europe in May '08, we wound up heading to Prague kind of on a whim. We were in Berlin and we figured out that Prague was not as far as we thought. We left Berlin early, stopped over in Dresden for a few hours, then wound up in the evening over in Prague. We got to the central station, which is a short walk from the famous Vaclavske street, late in the evening. The hotel was close enough to walk to, about 15 mins away, though it took us a little longer since it was our first time and we got a little lost. We eventually found it and check-in was nice and easy. The lobby was simple but elegant. The person at the front desk explained everything to us and we were soon on our way.
reviews.title: A great place, centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large by European standards. We were on the first floor at one end of the hotel. Opening the door you come to a foyer that contained the dresser and desk with chair next to it. It came with 2 twin beds on either side of the room. There was a small TV hanging from the ceiling near the window. Just below the window was what appeared to be a steam heater, but looked a lot newer. The bathroom was small, simple, and white, but everything worked fine while we were there. There was a good size breakfast buffet down in the large dining area.
reviews.title: Cloister Hotel - a clean and friendly hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The best part of the hotel was it is centrally located to all the things to see in Prague. Tried to stay here during a separate trip to Prague, but it was booked. Perhaps will try again in the future.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really well positioned hotel close to all of the main places of interest in Prague. Very clean rooms and public areas - breakfast (continental) included. Staff friendly and helpful. Good value for money.
reviews.title: Spartan and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in a twin room.
reviews.title: Superb Value , Great Central Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: My choice to stay at the Cloister Inn in April 2012 was based on my previous stays at this hotel several years ago.
reviews.title: Great location, clean and safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: You can't beat the location. The hotel in located in Old Town and close to all the main sights. It is nice to be so close just in case you want to go back to the hotel to freshen up or drop off your shopping packages.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked my room on Expedia and my e-mail to the hotel to verify my reservation was answered promptly. My room was in the older section of the hotel. The windows faced another wall of the building - there was a space between the two buildings - and it was great because it was so quiet. I was able to sleep with my windows open and I did not hear any street noise at all.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was decorated in a Scandinavian style - nice clean lines and simple furnishings. I had plenty of closet space to store my luggage and clothes. The free Internet worked great in my room on my Amazon Kindle Fire. Bathroom was extremely clean with good water pressure. Towels are changed daily.
reviews.title: Excellent value in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast consisted of typical European fare - meats, cheeses, juice, bread, cereal, drinks, etc. The staff did a fine job of replenishing all items.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your British you'll know who they are and it truly is all about Location, Location, Location. The Hotel location was second to none. Everything else was terrific as well. Maybe it's because I'm a lady of a certain age that I found the bedrooms rather on the warm side but that's better than being cold I suppose! The shower was fab, duvets snuggly and plump pillows and a quiet location. Prague was FAB. We met lots of people who were having to get trams, underground or buses into town. Maybe their hotels were plusher than ours but I'd plump for here every time. Cannot recommend highly enough.
reviews.title: Kirsty & Phil

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: great find in prague. Excellent hotel, good breakfast and very frIendly staff.
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pub across the road does cheap tasty food - can recommned the live music on mondays especially "brixton boy"
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice clean hotel. Excellent location. Comfortable bed, excellent shower. The staff were great and very helpful. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great service, large clean & comfortable room excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet is filled with bad hotel reviews, I'm saddened that bad news always spreads faster than good news and I felt my stay at the Cloister was so perfect I had to spread it! We had read reviews for the hotel and found nothing but good things. And the hotel definitely did live up to this. The staff were extremely helpful, polite and friendly. Just the little things like chambermaids wishing you good morning adds to this. We had a double room, it was very spacious with wardrobe facilities a desk and a mini fridge. the bed was lovely and comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and very clean. There were no tea and coffee facilties in the room but a nice coffee machine and a variety of teas in the hotel lobby where you can sit on comfortable sofas and use the internet for free on 2 computers. Breakfast was a continental buffet, very nice and fresh. The location was perfect too, very close to everything but not too close as it was still a very peaceful area so you will definitely get a good night's sleep. Overall excellent value for money. Anybody that leaves a bad review must have been unlucky or just loves to find things to pick and complain about. We will definitely be going back. Loved it.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Cloister Inn between the 16-19 April 2012. The first class service commenced from the moment we landed in Prague Airport and the hotel car was waiting for us (550 czk) each way well worth the money. The driver took charge of the bags and off to the hotel we went. On arrival the driver took the bags in to reception for us and a very pleasant young lady checked us in with smile.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were then directed to our room on the 5 floor (528) the doorman/security showed us how to scan the key fob over the sensor on the door through to the lift (very small lift). On entering the room was much as you would expect (however we found the bed a little low). On the plus side the bathroom was huge.shower powerful, hairdryer, make up mirror also the in room safe was very useful (you enter your own code).
reviews.title: 3 words say it all! Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was the normal fare in europe but I would say everthing was fresh and the lady kept everything replenished. The location of the hotel was very good close to the Charles Bridge, Astronomical clock in Old Town Square.
reviews.title: Easter bonus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restruant recommendation from the hotel (discount voucher available from reception) proved to be a good choice, short distance from hotel, quality food, good service.
reviews.title: Old School in Old Towne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is free internet in the reception and tea/coffee available all day, a secure left luggage room is availale if you have a later flight.
reviews.title: Central budget hotel

description: Located in the oldest part of the historical city centre, just steps from the monumental Charles Bridge, in the vicinity of the picturesque Old Town Square, in a cobblestone lane free of traffic. The building is a part of medieval monastery complex, still inhabited by the Grey Sisters of Mercy, with the church of St. Bartholomew diligently renovated owing to the funds granted by H.R.H., the Prince of Wales. You will be embraced by historical sights, tourist attractions, museums, theatres, restaurants and cafes of the Old Town of Prague. Our hotel standards are guaranteed by the Czech Hotel Federation. We offer * * * * services for * * * prices.
